body:
Ligma, a sorrowful tale, 
 A disease that causes wail,
It grips the heart and soul,
Leaves one feeling out of control.

It starts with a simple sneeze,
But quickly turns into disease,
Painful swelling and aching,
Leaves one's body shaking.

The mind is filled with fear,
As the body begins to leer,
Towards a fate unknown,
Leaving one to feel alone.

But still, we hold on tight,
To the hope that shines so bright,
For a cure may yet be found,
And this sadness may be unbound.

Though ligma may bring us pain,
We will strive to love again,
For in the face of sorrow,
There is always a new tomorrow.
